benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/tags - Add tags to account

covered: Valid Payload: Multiple scenarios (TC01, TC02, TC03, TC04, TC05, TC18) verify successful creation and 201 responses for valid inputs including single, multiple and large payloads.
Required Headers: TC11 verifies missing required header behaviour and many scenarios ensure X-Killbill-CreatedBy is provided; TC03 covers optional headers X-Killbill-Reason and X-Killbill-Comment.
Input Validation: TC07, TC08, TC09, TC12, TC13, TC17, TC23 cover malformed/empty bodies, malformed UUIDs, missing/invalid accountId and unexpected fields.
Resource Existence: TC10 and TC14 cover non-existent tag definitions and non-existent accounts.
Authorization: TC15 covers missing/invalid authentication token (401).
Error Handling / Service Unavailability: TC16 simulates dependency failure and expects a 503.
Duplicate Handling / Concurrency: TC19 and TC21 test duplicate tag IDs in a request and concurrent submissions to avoid duplicate tags.
Query Parameters Ignored: TC06 verifies query params (pagination/sorting/filter) are ignored for this POST endpoint.
Performance & Regression: TC20 tests response time boundary; TC22 and TC23 cover injection and regression special-character cases; TC24 ensures backward compatibility with API version 1.0.
gaps: HTTP/Content Headers & Schema: No explicit tests verify Content-Type handling (application/json required), response Content-Type, or validate the Tag object schema fields (IDs, timestamps, createdBy, etc.) returned in the 201 response.

500 Internal Server Error: Server error handling is only covered via 503 (service unavailable); there is no explicit test for an internal 500 (e.g., DB failure resulting in 500) and general server error semantics.
Authorization granularity (403): There is no test for authenticated but unauthorized users (insufficient permissions) returning 403.
Idempotency / Repeated Submissions: No explicit test for identical repeated POST requests (client retries) to ensure idempotent or well-defined behavior across retries.
Partial Success / Atomicity: No tests check behavior when some tag IDs in the same request are valid and others are invalid (is operation atomic or partial?).
Content-Type and Accept header variations: No tests for wrong/missing Content-Type or Accept headers and expected error codes.
Error response structure: Tests check presence of error messages but do not assert consistent error response schema (error codes, error keys, localization, machine-readable fields).
Rate Limiting and Throttling: No tests for rate limits / throttling under many rapid requests (distinct from concurrency correctness).
Caching / Response Headers: No tests for caching-related headers (ETag, Cache-Control) or whether POST responses include relevant headers.
Very large payloads beyond 100: Boundary test exists (100) but no tests for extreme large payloads, payload size limits, or server rejection for too-large requests.
Duplicate resource across requests: No explicit test verifying behavior when re-adding a tag that already exists from a prior successful request (beyond concurrent duplicate handling).
recommendations: Add schema-level assertions for success responses: validate Tag object fields (id, tagDefinitionId, objectType, objectId, createdBy, createdDate, etc.) and assert response Content-Type is application/json.
Add tests for 500 Internal Server Errors (e.g., simulate DB exception) to verify API returns appropriate 5xx and error payload.
Add authorization-granularity tests to cover 403 Forbidden (authenticated but insufficient permissions).
Add idempotency/retry tests: repeat the same POST and verify expected behavior (either safe retry semantics or appropriate error/status).
Add partial-failure tests: submit mixed valid/invalid tag IDs in one request to define and assert atomic vs partial success behavior and database state after failure.
Add tests for Content-Type and Accept header handling (missing/wrong Content-Type should return 4xx).
Define and test error response schema and messages consistently (keys, machine-readable codes) so clients can parse errors reliably.
Add rate-limiting/throttling tests (many sequential requests) to detect 429 or other limiting behavior and ensure graceful handling.
Add tests for caching/response headers on POST responses where applicable and verify no unsafe caching is applied; while POST is not typically cached, ensure headers are appropriate.
Extend large-payload testing beyond 100 items and include tests for server-enforced payload size limits and behavior when exceeded.
Add tests for re-adding an already-existing tag in a subsequent request (not concurrent) to verify expected deduplication/response semantics.
